User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the REON AI Prep application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

riId.description: REON ID, the master key for tracking user data. Format: R<dateofbirth><userfirstletter>T

targetExam.description: User's target exam (e.g., Railway, Bank, SSC, GATE, PSU, UPSC).

profilePhoto.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the user account was created.

lastLogin.description: Timestamp of the user's last login.

Material.title: Material
Material.description: Represents a study material file uploaded by a user.

userId.description: ID of the user who uploaded the material.

url.description: Firebase Storage URL of the file.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the material was uploaded.

UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Stores additional profile information for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

currentStage.description: User's current stage of exam preparation.

dailyAvailableHours.description: Number of hours the user can study daily.

Quiz.title: Quiz
Quiz.description: Represents a quiz taken by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the quiz entity.

questions.description: Number of questions in the quiz.

timeTaken.description: Time taken to complete the quiz (in minutes).

dateTaken.description: Date when the quiz was taken.

PracticeTest.title: PracticeTest
PracticeTest.description: Represents a practice test taken by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the practice test entity.

mode.description: Practice test mode (Manual, AI, Custom AI).

level.description: Practice test difficulty level (Moderate, Hard, Extreme).

questions.description: Number of questions in the practice test.

timeTaken.description: Time taken to complete the practice test (in minutes).

dateTaken.description: Date when the practice test was taken.

MockTest.title: MockTest
MockTest.description: Represents a mock test taken by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the mock test entity.

exam.description: Mock test exam type (RRB NTPC, SBI PO, etc.).

timeTaken.description: Time taken to complete the mock test (in minutes).

dateTaken.description: Date when the mock test was taken.

PodcastListening.title: PodcastListening
PodcastListening.description: Represents a user's listening history for a podcast.

id.description: Unique identifier for the podcast listening entity.

listenedDuration.description: Duration of the podcast episode listened to (in minutes).

dateListened.description: Date when the podcast episode was listened to.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the notification entity.

type.description: Notification type (Exam, Result, News, Admit Card, etc.).

officialLink.description: Link to the official source of the notification.

isRead.description: Indicates whether the notification has been read by the user.

FileConversion.title: FileConversion
FileConversion.description: Represents a file conversion performed by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the file conversion entity.

userId.description: Reference to User.  Can be null if the conversion was performed in guest mode.

originalFileType.description: Type of the original file (PDF, Word, Image, etc.).

convertedFileType.description: Type of the converted file (PDF, Word, Image, etc.).

conversionDate.description: Date when the file conversion was performed.

isGuestMode.description: Indicates whether the conversion was performed in guest mode.

LeaderboardEntry.title: LeaderboardEntry
LeaderboardEntry.description: Represents an entry in the leaderboard.

score.description: User's score for the leaderboard calculation.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the leaderboard entry was last updated.

state.description: State of the user to display in the leaderboard.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and support secure list operations (QAPs). It uses path-based ownership for user-specific data and denormalization to avoid `get()` calls in security rules. Every document contains the necessary authorization information within itself, eliminating the need to fetch parent document data during security rule evaluation. This approach ensures that all operations, including atomic transactions and batches, can be performed securely and efficiently.

*   **Users Collection (`/users/{userId}`):** Stores user profile information. Access is restricted to the authenticated user.
*   **Materials Collection (`/users/{userId}/materials/{materialId}`):** Stores metadata for user-uploaded files, ensuring only the owner can access them.
*   **User Profile Collection (`/users/{userId}/profiles/{profileId}`):** Stores additional user profile data, and only accessible to that user.
*   **Quizzes Collection (`/users/{userId}/quizzes/{quizId}`):** Stores quiz data, ensuring users can only access their own quizzes.
*   **Practice Tests Collection (`/users/{userId}/practiceTests/{practiceTestId}`):** Stores practice test results, ensuring users can only access their own practice tests.
*   **Mock Tests Collection (`/users/{userId}/mockTests/{mockTestId}`):** Stores mock test results, ensuring users can only access their own mock tests.
*   **Podcast Listening Collection (`/users/{userId}/podcastListening/{podcastListeningId}`):** Stores podcast listening history, ensuring users can only access their own listening history.
*   **Notifications Collection (`/users/{userId}/notifications/{notificationId}`):** Stores user-specific notifications, ensuring users can only access their own notifications.
*   **File Conversions Collection (`/fileConversions/{fileConversionId}`):** File conversions are global, and access should be public, but userId can be checked and restrict access to only users for whom userId matches request.auth.uid and can be created if auth is null.
*   **Leaderboard Entries Collection (`/leaderboardEntries/{leaderboardEntryId}`):** Global leaderboard data. Access should be open for reading but restricted for modifications to prevent abuse.  Consider a Cloud Function triggered on write to validate data or limit write access to a service account.

This structure supports the QAPs by:

1.  **Segregation:**  Each user's data is stored under their unique `userId`, preventing unauthorized access.
2.  **Authorization Independence:** Access control information (e.g., ownership) is denormalized, avoiding costly and insecure `get()` calls in rules.
3.  **DBAC:**  Authorization is based solely on `request.auth.uid`, simplifying role management and security rule logic.
4.  **Rules are not Filters:** Secure `list` operations are possible because rules only need to check `request.auth.uid` against the document's `userId` or `members` map (which, again, is denormalized).
